item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: FTX was the most successful anti-crypto psyop to date.
Reminders are useful. Same thing will happen again and again if we don’t learn from the past.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: say whatever you want about eigen but they have some of the smartest and thoughtful brains in our space.
folks like @nima_vaziri gives us a glimpse of why crypto matters in a convoluted world full if ai breakthroughs.
bro bing deeply appreciates these convos, esp during crime seasons
item.dc:creator: @hotpot_dao
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Open, neutral, decentralized infrastructure must be the foundation for the future of US and global economic activity
Neutral infra provides a universal, persistent value proposition to any application or user—empowering them to refine, extend, and build upon that neutral stratum to meet an endless set of evolving needs
Systems that are biased, controlled, and otherwise not decentralized are fundamentally narrower - constricting innovation, encouraging local rather than global maxima, hampering free-market growth, and ultimately leading us to a more brittle outcome in an increasingly dynamic world
Decentralization truly matters if we're aiming for the largest possible positive impact on the US and the world, and *Ethereum remains our best bet*
item.dc:creator: @dannyryan
item.description:
Open, neutral, decentralized infrastructure must be the foundation for the future of US and global economic activity

Neutral infra provides a universal, persistent value proposition to any application or user—empowering them to refine, extend, and build upon that neutral stratum to meet an endless set of evolving needs

Systems that are biased, controlled, and otherwise not decentralized are fundamentally narrower - constricting innovation, encouraging local rather than global maxima, hampering free-market growth, and ultimately leading us to a more brittle outcome in an increasingly dynamic world

Decentralization truly matters if we're aiming for the largest possible positive impact on the US and the world, and *Ethereum remains our best bet*

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: The Onchain Privacy Trilemma:
1. Maximally useful: supports private payments and anonymous DeFi 2. Self-sovereign: no reliance on intermediaries, MPC, or TEEs for privacy 3. Threat resistant: adversaries (e.g. NK) cannot use it to hack & launder funds
Choose any 2, but never 3
item.dc:creator: @_weidai
item.description:
The Onchain Privacy Trilemma:

1. Maximally useful: supports private payments and anonymous DeFi
2. Self-sovereign: no reliance on intermediaries, MPC, or TEEs for privacy
3. Threat resistant: adversaries (e.g. NK) cannot use it to hack & launder funds

Choose any 2, but never 3

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: Great work by our engineering and research teams, the third iteration of our zkVM is out. And thank you to our colleagues at @StarkWareLtd for the backend!
item.dc:creator: @JensGroth16
item.description:
Great work by our engineering and research teams, the third iteration of our zkVM is out. And thank you to our colleagues at @StarkWareLtd for the backend!

nitter.freedit.eu/NexusLabs/status/1897722941288464419#m

item.title: R to @fede_intern: repo: https://github.com/yetanotherco/zkvm_benchmarks web: https://zkbenchmarks.com
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
repo: github.com/yetanotherco/zkvm…
web: zkbenchmarks.com

item.title:
With @alignedlayer we're working on a RISC-V zkVM reproducible benchmark. Every team will be able to submit PRs and the benchmarks are going to be run every week with the updates of every codebase. We are going to use docker (hopefully we can use nix in the future) and Jupyter notebook. We still need to do many improvements.
We will add @NexusLabs with @StarkWareLtd Stwo prover in the upcoming days.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
With @alignedlayer we're working on a RISC-V zkVM reproducible benchmark. Every team will be able to submit PRs and the benchmarks are going to be run every week with the updates of every codebase. We are going to use docker (hopefully we can use nix in the future) and Jupyter notebook. We still need to do many improvements.

We will add @NexusLabs with @StarkWareLtd Stwo prover in the upcoming days.

item.title:
Quick question @ethereumfndn: we want to add 3 full time good engineers to the development of geth. We have done so to multiple projects, for example @Commit_Boost.
Who should we contact? We can start by working on small tickets and showing our capabilities.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
Quick question @ethereumfndn: we want to add 3 full time good engineers to the development of geth. We have done so to multiple projects, for example @Commit_Boost.

Who should we contact? We can start by working on small tickets and showing our capabilities.

item.title:
I agree with @lightclients.
The biggest issue I have with the take over of every part of the @ethereum pipeline by @paradigm is that they are selling their technical work in infra as if it was good when it’s really bad.
we will have to provide an alternative and explain to the market why it’s bad and what are the concrete advantages of doing things correctly.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
I agree with @lightclients.

The biggest issue I have with the take over of every part of the @ethereum pipeline by @paradigm is that they are selling their technical work in infra as if it was good when it’s really bad.

we will have to provide an alternative and explain to the market why it’s bad and what are the concrete advantages of doing things correctly.

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: because there is no spec for solidity - once they have a compiler, why do they need to “follow” the system set forth by the solidity team? the control the complete pipeline for developers from impl, testing, deployment, and mgmt.
item.dc:creator: @lightclients
item.description: because there is no spec for solidity - once they have a compiler, why do they need to “follow” the system set forth by the solidity team? the control the complete pipeline for developers from impl, testing, deployment, and mgmt.

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: it’s hard to interpret this as anything other than a hostile takeover of solidity lang? is this really the highest leverage strategy here? IMO there is so much to be gained by taking a totally different approach to smart contract languages.
item.dc:creator: @lightclients
item.description: it’s hard to interpret this as anything other than a hostile takeover of solidity lang? is this really the highest leverage strategy here? IMO there is so much to be gained by taking a totally different approach to smart contract languages.

item.title: Agree, there are only a few exceptions.
